title: Curecanti National Recreation Area: East Portal
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Eating & Sleeping     Camping     East Portal                East Portal Campground              East Portal Campground is located 2 miles downstream of Crystal Dam at the bottom of Black Canyon. Take CO Highway 347 6 miles north from the junction with U.S. Highway 50 to the entrance of Black Canyon of the Gunnison National Park. Turn right just past the entrance station, and follow East Portal Road 5 miles down to the campground.  The campground is shaded by box elder trees, is located near the historic Gunnison River Diversion Tunnel, and is immediately east of the Black Canyon of the Gunnison National Park boundary. All sites are first-come first-served.  Note: Vehicles exceeding 22 feet in length (including trailer) are not permitted on the East Portal Road because of the steep 16% grade and sharp, narrow curves. Black Canyon of the Gunnison National Park entrance fee applies to those accessing East Portal.          Approximate Open Dates: May to mid-October   Sites: 15   Accessible Sites: no    Water:  yes, mid-May to mid-September    Flush Toilets:  no   Vault Toilets:  yes    Tables & Fire Grates: yes   Elevation:  6526 feet                 Fees     All Sites $16.00 per night ($8.00 per night with Interagency Senior/Access Pass)
